result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio D. Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antonio D. Alexander is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Antonio D. Alexander was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.
May not have contact with felons or convicted drug offenders, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Fields-Bowers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions, consecutive to 10CF77 and concurrent to 16CF963; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.  No contact w/felons or convicted drug offenders.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Fields-Bowers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Fields-Bowers states the deft is still considering the State's offer.  STC set for 11/11/16 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
from DE re: return of phone and money

Defendant Antonio D. Alexander appeared with Attorney James LeRoy Fields-Bowers.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  DA  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 08:45 am.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(3g)(e) -Poss of THC - 2nd & Subsequent, Repeater   946.41(1) -Obstructing an Officer, Repeater

1:26 pm    Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk:  JT.   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 9-13-16 @ 8:15.  Warrant vacated.  $3000 signature bond set with conditions.
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.
